We rolled in a little hot after walking over two miles with five kids (it's not really set up for kids but they dealt well).  Patio was perfect place for cooling off, giving kids a place to run down to beach/ocean and incredible people watching.  Service was definitely adequate and food was traditional spanish albeit in larger portions than we've experienced.  Gazpacho incredible but a meal by itself, patatas buhran (think sliced potatoes covered in good nacho cheese) were incredible.  Salmon tartar, fideua and fried eggs with papas y jamon (only in Spain)...all excellent. For location prices reasonable.
